div1.ab: Consulate of the United States of America Bathurst R. Gambia 1st August 1879
div1.p: Sir, I have to acknowledge receipt of your despatch of the 20th March last conferring upon me the honor of the appointment of Vce Consul for the United States at this Port.
I feel duly sensible of the confidence thus to warosome and I am also gratified by the expression of satisfaction states in the despatch of the discharge of the duties of the Consulate by my late .

I am seeking to close up my business and to withdraw from Africa I am thus obliged to decline the honor of the appointment conferrede
The Honorable F.W. Seward Assistant Secretary Department of State
I return the blank Bond- Imill take care of the archives of the office, and look after the interests of the Citizens of the United States until a fresh appointment be made.

I take leave to recommend to you Mr. Harry Goddard well knowm to me from Childhood, he is a young Gentleman of high honor and principle, the son of Mr. William Goddard of the firm of Messro Williams Goddard of this place, and every way fitted by his social position + education to fill the office- he is at present in England but be coming out in January .
I am Sir Your obident servant Thomas Brown
